DataElement.preferredName: Recurrent Ipsilateral Breast Neoplasm Diagnosis Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the patient has been diagnosed with a first ipsilateral breast neoplasm recurrence.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to diagnosis (investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms) of a recurrent ipsilateral (the same side of body) breast neoplasm.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: occurring again.:Having to do with the same side of the body.:One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the same side of the body.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient been diagnose
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been diagnosed with first ipsilateral breast tumor recurrence

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been diagnosed with an invasive or non-invasive recurrence in the ipsilateral breast that has not been previously reported

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients with prior in-situ or invasive breast carcinomas are eligible if the prior carcinomas occurred in the contralateral breast. Patients with prior in-situ or invasive carcinomas of the ipsilateral breast are not eligible

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of ipsilateral invasive breast cancer or ipsilateral DCIS?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the First Recurrence DCIS Alone in the ipsilateral breast following lumpectomy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any prior history, not including the index cancer, of ipsilateral invasive breast cancer or ipsilateral DCIS treated with radiation therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: AECC Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been diagnosed with ipsilateral breast tumor recurrence

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have previous ipsilateral or contralateral DCIS

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any history, not including the index cancer, of ipsilateral invasive breast cancer or ipsilateral DCIS treated or not treated?
